trans-unit.source: Contains functionality common to row header cells and column header cells.
This class is a base class for other header cell classes, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>.
To create custom row header icons or column header glyphs, inherit from the DataGridViewHeaderCell class and add functionality to paint your own icon or glyph.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell"></xref> class.
Gets the buttonlike visual state of the header cell.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> is like a button in that it can be clicked to set states, such as sorting or performing row-level selection.
The ButtonState property uses <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState?displayProperty=fullName> values to provide buttonlike visual states.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState"></xref> values; the default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState"></xref>.
Creates an exact copy of this cell.
Override the Clone method whenever you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> and add new properties to the derived class.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the cloned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the cell is currently displayed on-screen.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the cell is on-screen or partially on-screen; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets the type of the formatted value of the cell.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Value%2A> property is the actual data object contained by the cell, whereas the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue%2A> property is the formatted representation of the data.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ValueType%2A> and FormattedValueType properties correspond to the data types of these values, respectively.
A <xref:System.Type> object representing the <xref:System.String> type.
Gets a value indicating whether the cell is frozen.
The Frozen property is `true` if the cell belongs to a frozen row or column, or if the cell is the top-left header cell.

A cell, row, or column is frozen when its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElement.State%2A> property has a value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates?displayProperty=fullName>
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the cell is frozen; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the cell is detached from a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
Gets the shortcut menu of the header cell.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> does not have a shortcut menu, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> will inherit the shortcut menu from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> also does not have a shortcut menu, then the GetInheritedContextMenuStrip method will return `null`.
Ignored by this implementation.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> has a shortcut menu assigned; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns a value indicating the current state of the cell as inherited from the state of its row or column.
The index of the row containing the cell or -1 if the cell is not a row header cell or is not contained within a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values representing the current state of the cell.
The cell is a column header cell or the control's and rowIndex is not -1.
Gets the size of the cell.

The GetSize method returns the size necessary to fit in a row of column headers if the header cell is a column header, the size necessary to fit in a column of row headers if the header cell is a row header, or the size necessary to be a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTopLeftHeaderCell> if the cell is a top left header cell.

If the cell is not attached to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Size%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> returns the value (-1,-1).
The row index of the header cell.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the size of the header cell.
The value of the property for this cell is and rowIndex does not equal -1. -or- The value of the property for this cell is not and rowIndex does not equal -1.

-or- The value of the property for this cell is not and rowIndex is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of rows in the control. -or- The values of the and properties of this cell are both and rowIndex does not equal -1.
The value of the property for this cell is not and rowIndex indicates a row other than the .
Gets the value of the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The value of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
rowIndex is not -1.
Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell in the row.
For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
MouseDownUnsharesRow is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseDown%2A>.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseDown%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`.
It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the mouse position.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the user clicks with the left mouse button, visual styles are enabled, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer moves over a cell in the row.
For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
MouseEnterUnsharesRow is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseEnter%2A>.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseEnter%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`.
It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The index of the row that the mouse pointer entered.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if visual styles are enabled, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer leaves the row.
For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
MouseLeaveUnsharesRow is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseLeave%2A>.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseLeave%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`.
It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The index of the row that the mouse pointer left.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState*> property value is not <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState"></xref>, visual styles are enabled, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is released while the pointer is on a cell in the row.
For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
MouseUpUnsharesRow is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseUp%2A>.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseUp%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`.
It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the mouse position.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the left mouse button was released, visual styles are enabled, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell.

The OnMouseDown method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState> if the cell is clicked with the left mouse button and visual styles are enabled for headers.
For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseDown%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseDown?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the mouse position.
Called when the mouse pointer enters the cell.

The OnMouseEnter method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState> if the left mouse button is pressed when the pointer enters the cell and visual styles are enabled for headers.
For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseEnter%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseEnter?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
The index of the row containing the cell.
Called when the mouse pointer leaves the cell.

The OnMouseLeave method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState> if it was in another state and visual styles are enabled for headers.
For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseLeave%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseLeave?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
The index of the row containing the cell.
Called when the mouse button is released while the pointer is over the cell.

The OnMouseUp method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState> if the left mouse button was released and visual styles are enabled for headers.
For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseUp%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseUp?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the mouse position.
Paints the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to paint the cell.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that needs to be repainted.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the bounds of the cell that is being painted.
The row index of the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that specifies the state of the cell.
The data of the cell that is being painted.
The formatted data of the cell that is being painted.
An error message that is associated with the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that contains formatting and style information about the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle"></xref> that contains border styles for the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewPaintParts"></xref> values that specifies which parts of the cell need to be painted.
Gets a value indicating whether the header cell is read-only.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in all cases.
An operation tries to set this property.
Gets a value indicating whether the cell is resizable.

A row header cell is resizable if the row is resizable or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersWidthSizeMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeadersWidthSizeMode>.

A column header cell is resizable if the column is resizable or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this cell can be resized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the cell is not attached to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cell is selected.
This property is not meaningful for header cells.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> in all cases.
This property is being set.
Returns a string that describes the current object.
A string that represents the current object.
Gets the type of the value stored in the cell.
A <xref:System.Type> object representing the <xref:System.String> type.
Gets a value indicating whether or not the cell is visible.
If the cell is a row header cell, then it is visible if its row is visible and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible%2A> property is `true`.
If the cell is a column header cell, then it is visible if its column is visible and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersVisible%2A> property is `true`.

If the cell is the top left header cell, it is visible if both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersVisible%2A> are true.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the cell is visible; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the cell is detached from a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>
